CatDescriptText: Mr. John Griffin, contractor, 1871 Linton Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe churches of any denomination receive appreciable financial help from racketeers?" answer reads: "No, I don't. In most cases it is a small amount.  Everybody has some good in him, and this is the same way with the racketeers.  As to whether or not the money is good or bad, I say that this depends on the use to which it is put."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John Griffin, wearing hat with dark band and long plaid jacket with top button undone, standing in front of store window, brick wall, and sign that reads "Lean Meaty Chunk 49c lb."
